glsa.title: Linux-PAM: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Linux-PAM, allowing remote attackers to bypass the auth process and cause Denial of Service.

background.p: Linux-PAM (Pluggable Authentication Modules) is an architecture allowing the separation of the development of privilege granting software from the development of secure and appropriate authentication schemes.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Linux-PAM. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: Remote attackers could cause Denial of Service, conduct brute force attacks, and conduct username enumeration.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
